IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To create better futures for disadvantaged people
IRS990.MissionDesc: To create better futures for disadvantaged people
IRS990.Desc: Running the Livelihood Impact Fund program, which provides grants and loans and intensive consulting support for organizations working to increase incomes for the poor.As part of the Livelihood Impact Fund program, Follow Your Dream has a team of staff, consultants and volunteers who work closely with our grantees. This team has specialized skills and expertise in a range of relevant areas. They provide capacity building support to our grantees and also oversee our research grants. In some areas, such as our eyeglass initiative, our director supervises and directs the activities of grantee organizations as part of our work to significantly increase the number of reading glasses distributed to low-income people. In these cases, grantees conduct activities under the general direction and supervision of Follow Your Dream.DDD has made program-related investments in several for-profit social enterprises, such as Kuza Koolers, Rashak and Farmworks. In these cases, we work closely with the organizations to build their capacity and help them strengthen their long-term impact.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Running programs to benefit poor youth in Cambodia

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FYD is exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. FYD has analyzed tax positions taken for filing with the Internal Revenue Service and state jurisdictions where it operates. FYD does not anticipate any significant uncertain tax positions that would require recognition in the financial statements. Periods ending June 30, 2020 and subsequent remain subject to examination by the taxing authorities

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 2 - Grantmakers Explanation For Monitoring Use of Funds Outside US
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: We do not monitor grants to 501c3 public charities, but for other grantees, we have grant agreements and ask for written confirmation of how the funds were used.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part II, Compensation from Unrelated Organizations
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 2:16 FUND, A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION (EIN 85-4221881), PAID JEREMY HOCKENSTEIN $50,000 AS A CONSULTANT (AND HE EARNED AN ADDITIONAL $56,666 IN DEFERRED COMPENSATION) IN THE CALENDAR YEAR 2022. THESE FEES WERE PAID TO ADVISE AND SUPPORT THE SETUP AND RUNNING OF the Livelihood Impact Fund program.
